He was even reduced to the wretched necessity (which indeed one cannot mention without loathing as well as lamenting) of having his teeth washed and cleansed by others; and he used frequently to say, when he was complaining of the ludecencies which his infirmitIes obliged him to suffer, thathe was every day forced to Iick his servants' lingere. Still, however, be lived, and was willing to accept of life which was mainly preserved to him by his wife, who, whatever censure she might incur by contracting the alliance, turned it to praise by her steadfast loyalty afterwards.

Now I have given you all the gossip of the town, where nothing Is talked of but Tullus. We are all eagerly awaiting the sale of his effects.
